official_title: To provide for the development of protocols for uniform national responses to public health emergencies involving dangerous biological agents or dangerous chemicals.
short_title: Hazardous Agent Emergency Uniform Response Act
subjects: Department of Health and Human Services

summary.text: Hazardous Agent Emergency Uniform Response Act - Directs the Secretary of Health and Human Services to develop protocols for responding to public health emergencies resulting from the release of dangerous biological agents or chemicals. Requires such protocols to be : (1) specific to the hazardous agent involved (unless the agent has no unique characteristics); and (2) uniformly applied through coordination with emergency response personnel, dissemination of appropriate medical information, testing, treatment, and decontamination. Requires differentiated responses for intentional (as opposed to accidental) releases.

titles.title: Hazardous Agent Emergency Uniform Response Act
To provide for the development of protocols for uniform national responses to public health emergencies involving dangerous biological agents or dangerous chemicals.
